alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 5:36PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Koyukuk River Downstream of Allakaket to Hughes. * WHEN...Until 100 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas is expected. Gravel bars will be submerged. Water will flow over banks into low lying areas and sloughs. Cabins in low lying areas could flood. Logs and other debris will fill the river. In Hughes, low lying areas of town could see minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 506 PM AKDT, Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell over the headwaters of the Koyukuk River earlier this week. High water is now moving down the Koyukuk River with water levels rising at many locations. The river is expected to crest at Allakaket on Monday morning, with the crest moving downstream to Hughes by 10 PM Tuesday. Water levels at Hughes are expected to rise 6 feet between now and Tuesday night. - For Koyukuk River at Hughes: At 4:30pm Sunday, the stage was 58.95 feet. Flood Stage is 64.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 65.2 feet is expected around 10:00pm Tuesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood People along the Koyukuk River downstream of Allakaket should move valuables such as boats and vehicles away from the river and secure them on higher ground. People should prepare for low roads and trails to become covered in water and impassable.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
